intro: Betula × alpina, commonly known as the mountain birch, is a hybrid species of birch native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is characterized by its white to yellow bark, which peels in thin, papery layers. The plant typically grows in boreal and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its leaves are alternate, triangular, and often have serrated edges. Betula × alpina plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
